column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Use a Cell Phone Safely when Driving
#Text=Doing anything that distracts you when driving is dangerous , whether it be eating , changing a CD , fiddling with the radio dials , or using a cell phone .
#Text=Talking on your cellphone while driving makes you four times more likely to crash .
#Text=This fact means that in many jurisdictions around the world , it is illegal to use a cellphone in the car .
#Text=This article discusses the means by which you can use a cellphone or mobile phone ( hand-held phones ) safely in the car .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Use a bluetooth headset .
#Text=Never directly answer the phone , handle it or fiddle with its dials .
#Text=Dialing while using a hand-held phone and driving makes you 2.8 times more likely to crash .
#Text=Speak and listen only using the bluetooth .
#Text=Use voice-activation rather than having to touch any buttons .
#Text=Check that this equipment is legal in your jurisdiction .
#Text=The safest approach to doing this is to start the call before you set off driving .
#Text=That way , you do n't need to touch any controls to get the call started .
#Text=Avoid answering the phone or using it at all while engaged in actual driving .
#Text=Turn your phone off or set it to silent .
#Text=That way , it cannot distract you at all and you wo n't feel compelled to answer it if it rings .
#Text=Whatever it is , it can wait until you 've stopped driving .
#Text=Never text while driving .
#Text=Sending a text takes your eyes off the road for four to five seconds , on average .
#Text=This means that , if you were traveling at 90kmh , you 'd travel the length of a rugby ( football ) field blindfolded .
#Text=Consider using a text response service .
#Text=Pull over and stop in a safe location .
#Text=If you really must answer or make a call , pull over safely to the side of the road and deal with your call while stationary .
#Text=Talking on a cellphone while driving decreases the driving concentration ability of your brain by over 37 percent .
#Text=Your reaction times slow down too , by fifty percent !
#Text=Put your phone out of reach .
#Text=Put it somewhere that will force you to pull over and stop in order to deal with the call rather than continue driving .
#Text=Ask a passenger to answer the phone and to relay the conversation to you and answer for you .
#Text=Do not make young children do this , however , as this can be both even more distracting for you and an unfair burden on them .
#Text=A passenger can send texts on your behalf , if necessary .
#Text=Ask the passenger to clarify with the recipient that they are the sender , to discourage more texting .
#Text=Finish calling or texting prior to getting into the car .
#Text=If you really need to get through to someone , think ahead and deal with it before driving .
#Text=Alternatively , talk or text on arrival at your destination .
#Text=It can also help to tell the person waiting for a call that you 're about to drive and ca n't answer until the trip has ended .
#Text=Let people know that you do n't answer or use the cellphone when driving .
#Text=The more people are aware that you do n't talk and drive or text and drive , tell them .
#Text=The sooner they know , the sooner they 'll accept that they ca n't expect you to be constantly available by phone and that it 's okay to wait to hear from you .
#Text=This will also help them to copy your example and feel okay that they do n't have be available by phone when driving either .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Be honest about your driving skills .

#Text=Most people think they can drive better than they actually can , hence it 's a good idea to presume that you are n't as skilled at being able to concentrate on driving while being distracted by a phone .
#Text=Avoid in-car phone use during peak hour , when on busy roads or when you 're tired , upset or frustrated .
#Text=Put your energies toward full concentration on the road .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Driving and using a hand-held phone is illegal in many jurisdictions across the world .
#Text=Using a cell phone while driving can result in you seriously injuring or killing yourself or someone else .
#Text=It is n't possible to devote your full attention to driving , the road , things happening around you and the phone buttons at the same time .
#Text=Remember it 's better to save your life then finding out what happened to your friends ex-boyfriend .
#Text=Talking and driving is a form of multi-tasking .
#Text=Human beings are not great at multi-tasking , so even just talking into the phone hands-free instead of concentrating on the road and driving can be distracting .
